summary: Site B has a 35% CDK4/6i utilization rate, 30% below the peer average. Closing this gap could yield $45,000/year.

clinical_impact.description: Improving Site B's utilization increases survival.

peer_comparison.description: Site B has a 35% CDK4/6i utilization rate, 43% below top-performing institutions. Leading cancer centers achieve 78% utilization with similar patient populations. Closing this gap to match top performers could yield $67,500/year.
action_steps: Arrange site visit between Site B and top-performing peer institutions
Implement peer center's CDK4/6i patient identification protocol at Site B
Develop standardized workflow based on peer best practices
Establish monthly peer comparison dashboard for site performance
Review workflow at Site B for CDK4/6i eligibility
Provide targeted education to Site B clinicians
suggestions: Share best practices from Site A with Site B

drilldowns.label: Variance by Regimen
drilldowns.cohort: ER+/HER2- MBC, 2L, Site B, by Regimen
